member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.Board
member.summary: Monday.com boards are where our users input all of their data and as such it is one of the core components of the platform and one of the main objects with which you will need to be familiar. The board’s structure is composed of rows(called items), groups of rows(called groups), and columns.The data of the board is stored in the items of the board and in the updates sections of each item. Each board has one or more owners and subscribers.

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Board.Id
member.summary: The unique identifier of the board.

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Board.BoardStateType
member.summary: The state of the board (all / active / archived / deleted), the default is active.

member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.BoardStateTypes
member.summary: The state of the board. (all / active / archived / deleted)

member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.Column
member.summary: Columns and items are two core elements of a board. A board is formatted as a table where there are columns and rows called items. In monday.com each column has a specific functionality it enables (ex. a numbers column, a text column, a time tracking column, etc.)

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Column.Settings
member.summary: The column's settings in a string form.

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.AutoNumber
member.summary: Number items according to their order in the group/board

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.Checkbox
member.summary: Check off items and see what's done at a glance

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.ColorPicker
member.summary: Manage a design system using a color palette

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.CreationLog
member.summary: Add the item creator and creation date automatically

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.Date
member.summary: Add dates like deadlines to ensure you never drop the ball

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.Dropdown
member.summary: Create a dropdown list of options

member.summary: Email team members and clients directly from your board

member.summary: Place multiple locations on a geographic map

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.LongText
member.summary: Add large amounts of text without changing column width

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.Numbers
member.summary: Add revenue, costs, time estimations and more

member.summary: Assign people to improve team work

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.Phone
member.summary: Call your contacts directly from monday.com

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.Progress
member.summary: Show progress by combining status columns in a battery

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.Status
member.summary: Get an instant overview of where things stand

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.Team
member.summary: Assign a full team to an item

member.summary: Add tags to categorize items across multiple boards

member.summary: Add textual information e.g. addresses, names or keywords

member.summary: Visually see a breakdown of your team's workload by time

member.summary: Vote on an item e.g. pick a new feature or a favorite lunch place

member.summary: Select the week on which each item should be completed

member.name: F:Monday.Client.Models.ColumnTypes.WorldClock

member.summary: The remainder of complexity after the query's execution.

member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.Group
member.summary: Items are grouped together in units called groups. Each board contains one or multiple groups, and each group can hold one or many items.

member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.Item
member.summary: Monday.com items are another core object in the platform. Items are the objects that hold the actual data within the board, to better illustrate this, you can think of a board as a table and a item as a single row in that table.

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Item.Board
member.summary: The board that contains this item.

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Item.Group
member.summary: The group that contains this item.

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Item.UserId
member.summary: The unique identifier of the item creator.

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Item.CreatedAtString
member.summary: Monday - Why is everything else a real DateTime except on pulses/items /sigh

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Item.UpdatedAtString
member.summary: Monday - Why is everything else a real DateTime except on pulses/items /sigh

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Reply.UserId
member.summary: The unique identifier of the reply creator.

member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.Tag
member.summary: Monday.com tags are objects that help you group items from different groups or different boards throughout your account by a consistent keyword. Tag entities are created and presented through the “Tags” column.

member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.Team
member.summary: Teams are the most efficient way to manage groups of users in monday.com. Teams are comprised of one or multiple users, and every user can be a part of multiple teams (or none).

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.Update.UserId
member.summary: The unique identifier of the update creator.

member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.User
member.summary: Every user in monday.com is a part of an account (i.e an organization) and could be a member or a guest in that account.

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.User.Photo
member.summary: The user's photo in the original size.

member.name: P:Monday.Client.Models.User.IsPending
member.summary: Is the user a pending user.

member.name: T:Monday.Client.Models.UserAccessTypes
member.summary: The kind to search users by (all / non_guests / guests / non_pending).
